column4: I have a serious problem with my system boot. When I try to start my pc a message like the following appears: "DISK BOOT FAILURE, INSERT SYSTEM DISK AND PRESS ENTER". I tried to boot from a liveCD with openSUSE 11.0 and I clik on the "Boot installed System" and it mount my hard disk and prompt me to the linux console(without GUI). Appart from it when I push the button to start my pc everything is going ok but the monitor seems to be like
there is no graphic card but aftrer 2 minutes it starts and the message that I was talking before appears(about the system boot). Sorry for my bad english! Any help appreciated...)
check you bios boot settings
I did it and I think everythink is ok. Do you have something in mind?
I did it and I think everythink is ok. Do you have something in mind?
make sure cd is first, then hard drive
I did it too and it is like that
then you havent install grub if the drive isnt bootable
have you ran all the way through the install process
you should power off and make sure everything is connected properly
I was staring the case for hours and everyting seemed to be ok
unplug and plug everytnhing in
What cable could caused it?
hard drive power or controller
I changed the hard disk sata cable and I changed a hard drive with Windows Xp intalled and the same problem appeared
maybe the drive is faulty
I try to boot two different hard disks one with Linux Ubuntu 7.10 and one with Windows Xp and there was the same problem with both
id take everything out again man, you may have a screw stuck. ive had that before
Anything else?
I dont think that it will help
thats all i can suggest, try a different power cable from the psu, or a new hdd cable
Thanks a lot. I hope that it will help to solve the problem!!!!
me too :)
